text: Is there a convincing reason why I shouldn t do this I dropped out of college  I ve never worked a real full time job  I m completely dependent on my husband both financially an emotionally  I struggle with anxiety and depression and I rarely feel like I ve done anything right on the best of days  Now I ve really fucked up  I cheated on him  in the worst way possible  I don t even want to go into the horrible details  He s dating someone else now and I can see him drifting further away from me emotionally  It s probably because I m sick a wreck and can t give him the time and space he needs to forgive me  He says he doesn t feel like I m his anymore and has stopped telling people that I m his wife  I m convinced that he s only still with me because he knows I have nowhere to go  I live to please him  I know that sounds unhealthy but I honestly can t help it  he means the world to me  I tried to be the perfect wife a for a while I was but as he says  I broke the contract  It s been voided  This is the biggest fuck up I ve ever made in my life  Even if I wanted to cut my losses  learn from this and move on  I have nothing in life to fall back on  Before this happened we d been trying for a baby for the better part of a year  Even my body is a failure  I can t live through this  Every breath I take feels like a small heart attack  I ve been crying every night for weeks  He was patient at first but now he s starting to get angry about it  He feels like I m being manipulative  I just want it end  He s buying me a ticket to go stay with my mom for a few months  I ve made up my mind to kill myself before then and I think I have about a week to do it  I ve planned it all out and wrote my suicide note  Before I go  I was wondering if there s any truly convincing reason not to do it

text: Need helpTrying to get better but  I keep having suicidal thoughts  I want to get better and trying my hardest but I think I m severely bipolar  When I m with my family and friends I m having a good time but  at times I hold myself back from becoming fully happy because I know my happiness won t last  I ve had depression probably all my life and this is kinda new to me but I m at the edge and for some reason I always find myself coming back to the edge   I m not scared of death  I m scared of leaving my family and friends guilt ridden and confused because I ve portrayed myself as a happy person all my life They re going to be sad and confused on why I did it   The thing is my mind and thoughts are in a constant war between wanting to kill myself or becoming better  I m very pessimistic about life because I ve had a very shit life  I didn t learn how to cope with it in a healthy way and it manifested in a lot of shitty ways of what I thought was right  but a lot of what I thought was right was a lie I told myself so it was easier to cope with I ve started realizing a lot of my wrongdoings a few months ago and I ve been reevaluating my entire life on what would be a good step forward in a positive direction  but the things I ve done in the past just makes me want to kill myself even more because they were that bad and I ve hurt people along the way   I can t forgive myself for some of the things I ve done  and having to fight this thing inside my head is exhausting  It s tiring and I m at the end of my rope  I m not scared of death  but knowing I can end all my pain by jumping off a bridge is tempting because I hate this depression for what it s doing to me and I would finally be free if I actually committed   TLDR  I want to get better but knowing I can end all the pain by jumping off a bridge is holding me back  I don t have anyone to talk to
summary: Trying to get better but keeps having suicidal thoughts. Has had depression probably all his life, but this is a new thing for him. He is pessimistic about life because he didn't learn how to cope with it in a healthy way. He doesn't forgive himself for some of the things he has done in the past.
